intro: Arabidium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine arabidium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
